<span class="line"><!---->[4]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/chrome_content_browser_client.cc;l=1421;drc=c6170265ae74b21355d013d08a0ad7a0b449d388<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/chrome_content_browser_client.cc;l=1421;drc=c6170265ae74b21355d013d08a0ad7a0b449d388"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/chrome_content_browser_client.cc;l=1421;drc=c6170265ae74b21355d013d08a0ad7a0b449d388<!----></a><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: M109 beta<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: M109 beta<!----></span><br>Operating System: test in win<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: test in win<!----></span><br><br>Bisect:<span class="line"><!---->Bisect:<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/c6170265ae74b21355d013d08a0ad7a0b449d388<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/c6170265ae74b21355d013d08a0ad7a0b449d388"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/c6170265ae74b21355d013d08a0ad7a0b449d388<!----></a><br>rogerta@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/rogerta@chromium.org"><!---->rogerta@chromium.org<!----></a> might be the right owner.<span class="line"><!----> might be the right owner.<!----></span><br><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>Apply the patch (or enable the preference `enterprise_connectors.on_file_attached` as in *). It has nothing to do with the vulnerability itself.<span class="line"><!---->Apply the patch (or enable the preference `enterprise_connectors.on_file_attached` as in *). It has nothing to do with the vulnerability itself.<!----></span><br><br>$ python ./copy_mojo_js_bindings.py /path/to/chrome/.../out/asan/gen<span class="line"><!---->$ python ./copy_mojo_js_bindings.py /path/to/chrome/.../out/asan/gen<!----></span><br>$ python3 -m http.server 8000<span class="line"><!---->$ python3 -m http.server 8000<!----></span><br>$ out/asan/chrome.exe --user-data-dir=xxxx  --enable-blink-features=MojoJS "<span class="line"><!---->$ out/asan/chrome.exe --user-data-dir=xxxx  --enable-blink-features=MojoJS "<!----></span>http://localhost:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/poc.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/poc.html<!----></a>"<span class="line"><!---->"<!----></span><br><br>[*] <span class="line"><!---->[*] <!----></span>https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/11375053<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/11375053"><!---->https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/11375053<!----></a><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br><br>Type of crash: browser.<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser.<!----></span><br>Crash State: see asan file.<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: see asan file.<!----></span><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Leecraso and Guang Gong of 360 Vulnerability Research Institute<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Leecraso and Guang Gong of 360 Vulnerability Research Institute<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          domfc@chromium.org

          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -OS-Android -OS-Fuchsia

        A UAF could happen as described.  ExpandPaths() starts a background task to explode directories into a set of all files descendent from them.  If the tab is closed before the background task can walk the directory trees to collect all the file names, when the background task replies to the originating task, an invalid web content pointer could be accessed.<span class="line"><!---->A UAF could happen as described.  ExpandPaths() starts a background task to explode directories into a set of all files descendent from them.  If the tab is closed before the background task can walk the directory trees to collect all the file names, when the background task replies to the originating task, an invalid web content pointer could be accessed.<!----></span><br><br>Repro steps:<span class="line"><!---->Repro steps:<!----></span><br>------------<span class="line"><!---->------------<!----></span><br>1/ Make sure to enable content analysis (This can only be set via cloud-based enterprise policies so this code path won't happen for consumer users).<span class="line"><!---->1/ Make sure to enable content analysis (This can only be set via cloud-based enterprise policies so this code path won't happen for consumer users).<!----></span><br>2/ Use the OS clipboard copy+paste to copy a directory containing a very large number of files.<span class="line"><!---->2/ Use the OS clipboard copy+paste to copy a directory containing a very large number of files.<!----></span><br>3/ Close the tab quickly.<span class="line"><!---->3/ Close the tab quickly.<!----></span><br><br>Content analysis works only on desktop platforms and cros.<span class="line"><!---->Content analysis works only on desktop platforms and cros.<!----></span><br><br>Carlos: you probably had a hard time repro'ing because you need either a slow computer, a slow disk, a very large/deep directory, or some combination of those things.<span class="line"><!---->Carlos: you probably had a hard time repro'ing because you need either a slow computer, a slow disk, a very large/deep directory, or some combination of those things.<!----></span><br><br>This fix is to pass a WekPtr<WebContents> rather than a naked WebContents pointer and to check that it is still valid.<span class="line"><!---->This fix is to pass a WekPtr&lt;WebContents&gt; rather than a naked WebContents pointer and to check that it is still valid.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        @rogerta:<span class="line"><!---->@rogerta:<!----></span><br><br>To prevent misunderstanding, let me clarify:<span class="line"><!---->To prevent misunderstanding, let me clarify:<!----></span><br><br>1. In my local testing, a very large/deep directory is not needed. Success rate: 3/10 for no file copy, 9/10 for one file copy. (quad-core, 8 GB memory, SSD for virtual machine)<span class="line"><!---->1. In my local testing, a very large/deep directory is not needed. Success rate: 3/10 for no file copy, 9/10 for one file copy. (quad-core, 8 GB memory, SSD for virtual machine)<!----></span><br><br>2. Even if you use a lot of files, it is unnecessary to paste the files into the web page or close the tab quickly, the JS code in the poc already does the same thing. Just copy the files you selected, and click the trigger button. If the `window.close()` in the JS code does not work, you can try the following patch:<span class="line"><!---->2.         Can you clarify "3/10 for no file copy"?  This bug happens if you try to copy files, it does not happen if you try to copy text.  Do I understand the bug correctly?<span class="line"><!---->Can you clarify "3/10 for no file copy"?  This bug happens if you try to copy files, it does not happen if you try to copy text.  Do I understand the bug correctly?<!----></span><br><br>Correct that a web page itself can trigger paste (via a user action like clicking a button), paste itself does not need to be a user action.  So agreed that a malicious web page could attempt to crash the browser.  So more generally the repro steps could be:<span class="line"><!---->Correct that a web page itself can trigger paste (via a user action like clicking a button), paste itself does not need to be a user action.  So agreed that a malicious web page could attempt to crash the browser.  So more generally the repro steps could be:<!----></span><br><br>1/ User action to copy one or more files into the OS clipboard.<span class="line"><!---->1/ User action to copy one or more files into the OS clipboard.<!----></span><br>2/ User action on the web page to either paste or trigger malicious code.<span class="line"><!---->2/ User action on the web page to either paste or trigger malicious code.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hi rogerta@:<span class="line"><!---->Hi rogerta@:<!----></span><br><br>This vulnerability does not need to copy files, even if you copy text or keep empty in the clipboard, calling `clipHostptr.readFiles` will execute the same path. It's just that `filenames.size()`[*] is 0 at this time, which will cause the time window to be small.<span class="line"><!---->This vulnerability does not need to copy files, even if you copy text or keep empty in the clipboard, calling `clipHostptr.readFiles` will execute the same path. It's just that `filenames.size()`[*] is 0 at this time, which will cause the time window to be small.<!----></span><br><br>[*] <span class="line"><!---->[*] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/enterprise/common/files_scan_data.cc;l=22;drc=96d6572877a23986bf712cf8676ea3978db4eb0f<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/enterprise/common/files_scan_data.cc;l=22;drc=96d6572877a23986bf712cf8676ea3978db4eb0f"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/enterprise/common/files_scan_data.cc;l=22;drc=96d6572877a23986bf712cf8676ea3978db4eb0f<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        LTS Milestone M108<span class="line"><!---->LTS Milestone M108<!----></span><br><br>This issue has been flagged as a merge candidate for Chrome OS' LTS channel. If selected, our merge team will handle any additional merges.         Description #1 by leecraso@gmail.com (Dec 5, 2022)
      <option value="0" selected="">

      <div class="select-container">

      UAF in HandleExpandedPaths<span class="line"><!---->UAF in HandleExpandedPaths<!----></span><br><br>VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>When processing the files read request from the clipboard, the current WebContent will be bound[1] into function `HandleExpandedPaths` as a callback. <span class="line"><!---->When processing the files read request from the clipboard, the current WebContent will be bound[1] into function `HandleExpandedPaths` as a callback. <!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void ChromeContentBrowserClient::IsClipboardPasteContentAllowed(<span class="line"><!---->void ChromeContentBrowserClient::IsClipboardPasteContentAllowed(<!----></span><br>    content::WebContents* web_contents,<span class="line"><!---->    content::WebContents* web_contents,<!----></span><br>    const GURL& url,<span class="line"><!---->    const GURL&amp; url,<!----></span><br>    const ui::ClipboardFormatType& data_type,<span class="line"><!---->    const ui::ClipboardFormatType&amp; data_type,<!----></span><br>    const std::string& data,<span class="line"><!---->    const std::string&amp; data,<!----></span><br>    IsClipboardPasteContentAllowedCallback callback) {<span class="line"><!---->    IsClipboardPasteContentAllowedCallback callback) {<!----></span><br>    [...]<span class="line"><!---->    [...]<!----></span><br>    fsd_ptr->ExpandPaths(base::BindOnce(&HandleExpandedPaths, std::move(fsd),   <--- 1.<span class="line"><!---->    fsd_ptr-&gt;ExpandPaths(base::BindOnce(&amp;HandleExpandedPaths, std::move(fsd),   &lt;--- 1.<!----></span><br>                                        web_contents, std::move(dialog_data),<span class="line"><!---->                                        web_contents, std::move(dialog_data),<!----></span><br>                                        connector, std::move(paths),<span class="line"><!---->                                        connector, std::move(paths),<!----></span><br>                                        std::move(callback)));<span class="line"><!---->                                        std::move(callback)));<!----></span><br>    [...]<span class="line"><!---->    [...]<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>This callback will run asynchronously[2][3]:<span class="line"><!---->This callback will run asynchronously[2][3]:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void FilesScanData::ExpandPaths(base::OnceClosure done_closure) {<span class="line"><!---->void FilesScanData::ExpandPaths(base::OnceClosure done_closure) {<!----></span><br>  expand_paths_done_closure_ = std::move(done_closure);    <-------- the callback expand_paths_done_closure_.<span class="line"><!---->  expand_paths_done_closure_ = std::move(done_closure);    &lt;-------- the callback expand_paths_done_closure_.<!----></span><br><br>  base::ThreadPool::PostTaskAndReplyWithResult(<span class="line"><!---->  base::ThreadPool::PostTaskAndReplyWithResult(<!----></span><br>      FROM_HERE, {base::TaskPriority::USER_VISIBLE, base::MayBlock()},<span class="line"><!---->      FROM_HERE, {base::TaskPriority::USER_VISIBLE, base::MayBlock()},<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(&GetPathsToScan, base_paths_),<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(&amp;GetPathsToScan, base_paths_),<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(&FilesScanData::OnExpandPathsDone, AsWeakPtr()));  <----[2] OnExpandPathsDone will be called after the ThreadPool task GetPathsToScan.<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(&amp;FilesScanData::OnExpandPathsDone, AsWeakPtr()));  &lt;----[2] OnExpandPathsDone will be called after the ThreadPool task GetPathsToScan.<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>void FilesScanData::OnExpandPathsDone(<span class="line"><!---->void FilesScanData::OnExpandPathsDone(<!----></span><br>    std::pair<ExpandedPathsIndexes, std::vector<base::FilePath>><span class="line"><!---->    std::pair&lt;ExpandedPathsIndexes, std::vector&lt;base::FilePath&gt;&gt;<!----></span><br>        indexes_and_paths) {<span class="line"><!---->        indexes_and_paths) {<!----></span><br>  expanded_paths_indexes_ = std::move(indexes_and_paths.first);<span class="line"><!---->  expanded_paths_indexes_ = std::move(indexes_and_paths.first);<!----></span><br>  expanded_paths_ = std::move(indexes_and_paths.second);<span class="line"><!---->  expanded_paths_ = std::move(indexes_and_paths.second);<!----></span><br>  std::move(expand_paths_done_closure_).Run();    <------[3] OnExpandPathsDone will run the callback expand_paths_done_closure_.<span class="line"><!---->  std::move(expand_paths_done_closure_).Run();    &lt;------[3] OnExpandPathsDone will run the callback expand_paths_done_closure_.<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>Therefore, if WebContent is destroyed before `OnExpandPathsDone` gets executed, the UAF will be triggered when it is accessed[4] later.<span class="line"><!---->Therefore, if WebContent is destroyed before `OnExpandPathsDone` gets executed, the UAF will be triggered when it is accessed[4] later.<!----></span><br><br>[1]. <span class="line"><!---->[1]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/chrome_content_browser_client.cc;l=6610;drc=c6170265ae74b21355d013d08a0ad7a0b449d388<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/chrome_content_browser_client.cc;l=6610;drc=c6170265ae74b21355d013d08a0ad7a0b449d388"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/chrome_content_browser_client.cc;l=6610;drc=c6170265ae74b21355d013d08a0ad7a0b449d388<!----></a><br>[2]. <span class="line"><!---->[2]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/enterprise/common/files_scan_data.cc;l=65;drc=96d6572877a23986bf712cf8676ea3978db4eb0f<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/enterprise/common/files_scan_data.cc;l=65;drc=96d6572877a23986bf712cf8676ea3978db4eb0f"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/enterprise/common/files_scan_data.cc;l=65;drc=96d6572877a23986bf712cf8676ea3978db4eb0f<!----></a><br>[3]. <span class="line"><!---->[3]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/enterprise/common/files_scan_data.cc;l=101;drc=96d6572877a23986bf712cf8676ea3978db4eb0f<a class="undefined" target="_blank" <span class="line"><!---->[4]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/chrome_content_browser_client.cc;l=1421;drc=c6170265ae74b21355d013d08a0ad7a0b449d388<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/chrome_content_browser_client.cc;l=1421;drc=c6170265ae74b21355d013d08a0ad7a0b449d388"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/chrome_content_browser_client.cc;l=1421;drc=c6170265ae74b21355d013d08a0ad7a0b449d388<!----></a><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: M109 beta<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: M109 beta<!----></span><br>Operating System: test in win<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: test in win<!----></span><br><br>Bisect:<span class="line"><!---->Bisect:<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/c6170265ae74b21355d013d08a0ad7a0b449d388<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/c6170265ae74b21355d013d08a0ad7a0b449d388"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/c6170265ae74b21355d013d08a0ad7a0b449d388<!----></a><br>rogerta@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/rogerta@chromium.org"><!---->rogerta@chromium.org<!----></a> might be the right owner.<span class="line"><!----> might be the right owner.<!----></span><br><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>Apply the patch (or enable the preference `enterprise_connectors.on_file_attached` as in *). It has nothing to do with the vulnerability itself.<span class="line"><!---->Apply the patch (or enable the preference `enterprise_connectors.on_file_attached` as in *). It has nothing to do with the vulnerability itself.<!----></span><br><br>$ python ./copy_mojo_js_bindings.py /path/to/chrome/.../out/asan/gen<span class="line"><!---->$ python ./copy_mojo_js_bindings.py /path/to/chrome/.../out/asan/gen<!----></span><br>$ python3 -m http.server 8000<span class="line"><!---->$ python3 -m http.server 8000<!----></span><br>$ out/asan/chrome.exe --user-data-dir=xxxx  --enable-blink-features=MojoJS "<span class="line"><!---->$ out/asan/chrome.exe --user-data-dir=xxxx  --enable-blink-features=MojoJS "<!----></span>http://localhost:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/poc.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/poc.html<!----></a>"<span class="line"><!---->"<!----></span><br><br>[*] <span class="line"><!---->[*] <!----></span>https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/11375053<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/11375053"><!---->https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/11375053<!----></a><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br><br>Type of crash: browser.<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser.<!----></span><br>Crash State: see asan file.<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: see asan file.<!----></span><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Leecraso and Guang Gong of 360 Vulnerability Research Institute<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Leecraso and Guang Gong of 360 Vulnerability Research Institute<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          domfc@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -OS-Android -OS-Fuchsia
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        A UAF could happen as described.  ExpandPaths() starts a background task to explode directories into a set of all files descendent from them.  If the tab is closed before the background task can walk the directory trees to collect all the file names, when the background task replies to the originating task, an invalid web content pointer could be accessed.<span class="line"><!---->A UAF could happen as described.  ExpandPaths() starts a background task to explode directories into a set of all files descendent from them.  If the tab is closed before the background task can walk the directory trees to collect all the file names, when the background task replies to the originating task, an invalid web content pointer could be accessed.<!----></span><br><br>Repro steps:<span class="line"><!---->Repro steps:<!----></span><br>------------<span class="line"><!---->------------<!----></span><br>1/ Make sure to enable content analysis (This can only be set via cloud-based enterprise policies so this code path won't happen for consumer users).<span class="line"><!---->1/ Make sure to enable content analysis (This can only be set via cloud-based enterprise policies so this code path won't happen for consumer users).<!----></span><br>2/ Use the OS clipboard copy+paste to copy a directory containing a very large number of files.<span class="line"><!---->2/ Use the OS clipboard copy+paste to copy a directory containing a very large number of files.<!----></span><br>3/ Close the tab quickly.<span class="line"><!---->3/ Close the tab quickly.<!----></span><br><br>Content analysis works only on desktop platforms and cros.<span class="line"><!---->Content analysis works only on desktop platforms and cros.<!----></span><br><br>Carlos: you probably had a hard time repro'ing because you need either a slow computer, a slow disk, a very large/deep directory, or some combination of those things.<span class="line"><!---->Carlos: you probably had a hard time repro'ing because you need either a slow computer, a slow disk, a very large/deep directory, or some combination of those things.<!----></span><br><br>This fix is to pass a WekPtr<WebContents> rather than a naked WebContents pointer and to check that it is still valid.<span class="line"><!---->This fix is to pass a WekPtr&lt;WebContents&gt; rather than a naked WebContents pointer and to check that it is still valid.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2" commenterismember=""></mr-comment>

        To expand on repro step #2 above (on Windows):<span class="line"><!---->To expand on repro step #2 above (on Windows):<!----></span><br><br>2.1/ Open the Windows explorer.<span class="line"><!---->2.1/ Open the Windows explorer.<!----></span><br>2.2/ Select a large directory like C:\Windows and type Ctrl+C to copy it.<span class="line"><!---->2.2/ Select a large directory like C:\Windows and type Ctrl+C to copy it.<!----></span><br>2.3/ Open a web page that accepts pasting from the clipboard.<span class="line"><!---->2.3/ Open a web page that accepts pasting from the clipboard.<!----></span><br>2.4/ Type Ctrl+V to paste the files into the web page.<span class="line"><!---->2.4/ Type Ctrl+V to paste the files into the web page.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        @rogerta:<span class="line"><!---->@rogerta:<!----></span><br><br>To prevent misunderstanding, let me clarify:<span class="line"><!---->To prevent misunderstanding, let me clarify:<!----></span><br><br>1. In my local testing, a very large/deep directory is not needed. Success rate: 3/10 for no file copy, 9/10 for one file copy. (quad-core, 8 GB memory, SSD for virtual machine)<span class="line"><!---->1. In my local testing, a very large/deep directory is not needed. Success rate: 3/10 for no file copy, 9/10 for one file copy. (quad-core, 8 GB memory, SSD for virtual machine)<!----></span><br><br>2. Even if you use a lot of files, it is unnecessary to paste the files into the web page or close the tab quickly, the JS code in the poc already does the same thing. Just copy the files you selected, and click the trigger button. If the `window.close()` in the JS code does not work, you can try the following patch:<span class="line"><!---->2.         Can you clarify "3/10 for no file copy"?  This bug happens if you try to copy files, it does not happen if you try to copy text.  Do I understand the bug correctly?<span class="line"><!---->Can you clarify "3/10 for no file copy"?  This bug happens if you try to copy files, it does not happen if you try to copy text.  Do I understand the bug correctly?<!----></span><br><br>Correct that a web page itself can trigger paste (via a user action like clicking a button), paste itself does not need to be a user action.  So agreed that a malicious web page could attempt to crash the browser.  So more generally the repro steps could be:<span class="line"><!---->Correct that a web page itself can trigger paste (via a user action like clicking a button), paste itself does not need to be a user action.  So agreed that a malicious web page could attempt to crash the browser.  So more generally the repro steps could be:<!----></span><br><br>1/ User action to copy one or more files into the OS clipboard.<span class="line"><!---->1/ User action to copy one or more files into the OS clipboard.<!----></span><br>2/ User action on the web page to either paste or trigger malicious code.<span class="line"><!---->2/ User action on the web page to either paste or trigger malicious code.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hi rogerta@:<span class="line"><!---->Hi rogerta@:<!----></span><br><br>This vulnerability does not need to copy files, even if you copy text or keep empty in the clipboard, calling `clipHostptr.readFiles` will execute the same path. It's just that `filenames.size()`[*] is 0 at this time, which will cause the time window to be small.<span class="line"><!---->This vulnerability does not need to copy files, even if you copy text or keep empty in the clipboard, calling `clipHostptr.readFiles` will execute the same path. It's just that `filenames.size()`[*] is 0 at this time, which will cause the time window to be small.<!----></span><br><br>[*] <span class="line"><!---->[*] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/enterprise/common/files_scan_data.cc;l=22;drc=96d6572877a23986bf712cf8676ea3978db4eb0f<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/enterprise/common/files_scan_data.cc;l=22;drc=96d6572877a23986bf712cf8676ea3978db4eb0f"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/enterprise/common/files_scan_data.cc;l=22;drc=96d6572877a23986bf712cf8676ea3978db4eb0f<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2" commenterismember=""></mr-comment>

      UAF in HandleExpandedPaths<span class="line"><!---->UAF in HandleExpandedPaths<!----></span><br><br>VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>When processing the files read request from the clipboard, the current WebContent will be bound[1] into function `HandleExpandedPaths` as a callback. <span class="line"><!---->When processing the files read request from the clipboard, the current WebContent will be bound[1] into function `HandleExpandedPaths` as a callback. <!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void ChromeContentBrowserClient::IsClipboardPasteContentAllowed(<span class="line"><!---->void ChromeContentBrowserClient::IsClipboardPasteContentAllowed(<!----></span><br>    content::WebContents* web_contents,<span class="line"><!---->    content::WebContents* web_contents,<!----></span><br>    const GURL& url,<span class="line"><!---->    const GURL&amp; url,<!----></span><br>    const ui::ClipboardFormatType& data_type,<span class="line"><!---->    const ui::ClipboardFormatType&amp; data_type,<!----></span><br>    const std::string& data,<span class="line"><!---->    const std::string&amp; data,<!----></span><br>    IsClipboardPasteContentAllowedCallback callback) {<span class="line"><!---->    IsClipboardPasteContentAllowedCallback callback) {<!----></span><br>    [...]<span class="line"><!---->    [...]<!----></span><br>    fsd_ptr->ExpandPaths(base::BindOnce(&HandleExpandedPaths, std::move(fsd),   <--- 1.<span class="line"><!---->    fsd_ptr-&gt;ExpandPaths(base::BindOnce(&amp;HandleExpandedPaths, std::move(fsd),   &lt;--- 1.<!----></span><br>                                        web_contents, std::move(dialog_data),<span class="line"><!---->                                        web_contents, std::move(dialog_data),<!----></span><br>                                        connector, std::move(paths),<span class="line"><!---->                                        connector, std::move(paths),<!----></span><br>                                        std::move(callback)));<span class="line"><!---->                                        std::move(callback)));<!----></span><br>    [...]<span class="line"><!---->    [...]<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>This callback will run asynchronously[2][3]:<span class="line"><!---->This callback will run asynchronously[2][3]:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void FilesScanData::ExpandPaths(base::OnceClosure done_closure) {<span class="line"><!---->void FilesScanData::ExpandPaths(base::OnceClosure done_closure) {<!----></span><br>  expand_paths_done_closure_ = std::move(done_closure);    <-------- the callback expand_paths_done_closure_.<span class="line"><!---->  expand_paths_done_closure_ = std::move(done_closure);    &lt;-------- the callback expand_paths_done_closure_.<!----></span><br><br>  base::ThreadPool::PostTaskAndReplyWithResult(<span class="line"><!---->  base::ThreadPool::PostTaskAndReplyWithResult(<!----></span><br>      FROM_HERE, {base::TaskPriority::USER_VISIBLE, base::MayBlock()},<span class="line"><!---->      FROM_HERE, {base::TaskPriority::USER_VISIBLE, base::MayBlock()},<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(&GetPathsToScan, base_paths_),<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(&amp;GetPathsToScan, base_paths_),<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(&FilesScanData::OnExpandPathsDone, AsWeakPtr()));  <----[2] OnExpandPathsDone will be called after the ThreadPool task GetPathsToScan.<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(&amp;FilesScanData::OnExpandPathsDone, AsWeakPtr()));  &lt;----[2] OnExpandPathsDone will be called after the ThreadPool task GetPathsToScan.<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>void FilesScanData::OnExpandPathsDone(<span class="line"><!---->void FilesScanData::OnExpandPathsDone(<!----></span><br>    std::pair<ExpandedPathsIndexes, std::vector<base::FilePath>><span class="line"><!---->    std::pair&lt;ExpandedPathsIndexes, std::vector&lt;base::FilePath&gt;&gt;<!----></span><br>        indexes_and_paths) {<span class="line"><!---->        indexes_and_paths) {<!----></span><br>  expanded_paths_indexes_ = std::move(indexes_and_paths.first);<span class="line"><!---->  expanded_paths_indexes_ = std::move(indexes_and_paths.first);<!----></span><br>  expanded_paths_ = std::move(indexes_and_paths.second);<span class="line"><!---->  expanded_paths_ = std::move(indexes_and_paths.second);<!----></span><br>  std::move(expand_paths_done_closure_).Run();    <------[3] OnExpandPathsDone will run the callback expand_paths_done_closure_.<span class="line"><!---->  std::move(expand_paths_done_closure_).Run();    &lt;------[3] OnExpandPathsDone will run the callback expand_paths_done_closure_.<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>Therefore, if WebContent is destroyed before `OnExpandPathsDone` gets executed, the UAF will be triggered when it is accessed[4] later.<span class="line"><!---->Therefore, if WebContent is destroyed before `OnExpandPathsDone` gets executed, the UAF will be triggered when it is accessed[4] later.<!----></span><br><br>[1]. <span class="line"><!---->[1]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/chrome_content_browser_client.cc;l=6610;drc=c6170265ae74b21355d013d08a0ad7a0b449d388<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/chrome_content_browser_client.cc;l=6610;drc=c6170265ae74b21355d013d08a0ad7a0b449d388"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/chrome_content_browser_client.cc;l=6610;drc=c6170265ae74b21355d013d08a0ad7a0b449d388<!----></a><br>[2]. <span class="line"><!---->[2]. owner.<!----></span><br><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>Apply the patch (or enable the preference `enterprise_connectors.on_file_attached` as in *).       <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          domfc@chromium.org
          
          <br>

          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -OS-Android -OS-Fuchsia

      </div><br>
    
        
      
        A UAF could happen as described.  ExpandPaths() starts a background task to explode directories into a set of all files descendent from them.  If the tab is closed before the background task can walk the directory trees to collect all the file names, when the background task replies to the originating task, an invalid web content pointer could be accessed.<span class="line"><!---->A UAF could happen as described.  ExpandPaths() starts a background task to explode directories into a set of all files descendent from them.  If the tab is closed before the background task can walk the directory trees to collect all the file names, when the background task replies to the originating task, an invalid web content pointer could be accessed.<!----></span><br><br>Repro steps:<span class="line"><!---->Repro steps:<!----></span><br>------------<span class="line"><!---->------------<!----></span><br>1/ Make sure to enable content analysis (This can only be set via cloud-based enterprise policies so this code path won't happen for consumer users).<span class="line"><!---->1/ Make sure to enable content analysis (This can only be set via cloud-based enterprise policies so this code path won't happen for consumer users).<!----></span><br>2/ Use the OS clipboard copy+paste to copy a directory containing a very large number of files.<span class="line"><!---->2/ Use the OS clipboard copy+paste to copy a directory containing a very large number of files.<!----></span><br>3/ Close the tab quickly.<span class="line"><!---->3/ Close the tab quickly.<!----></span><br><br>Content analysis works only on desktop platforms and cros.<span class="line"><!---->Content analysis works only on desktop platforms and cros.<!----></span><br><br>Carlos: you probably had a hard time repro'ing because you need either a slow computer, a slow disk, a very large/deep directory, or some combination of those things.<span class="line"><!---->Carlos: you probably had a hard time repro'ing because you need either a slow computer, a slow disk, a very large/deep directory, or some combination of those things.<!----></span><br><br>This fix is to pass a WekPtr<WebContents> rather than a naked WebContents pointer and to check that it is still valid.<span class="line"><!---->This fix is to pass a WekPtr&lt;WebContents&gt; rather than a naked WebContents pointer and to check that it is still valid.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        @rogerta:<span class="line"><!---->@rogerta:<!----></span><br><br>To prevent misunderstanding, let me clarify:<span class="line"><!---->To prevent misunderstanding, let me clarify:<!----></span><br><br>1. In my local testing, a very large/deep directory is not needed. Success rate: 3/10 for no file copy, 9/10 for one file copy. (quad-core, 8 GB memory, SSD for virtual machine)<span class="line"><!---->1. In my local testing, a very large/deep directory is not needed. Success rate: 3/10 for no file copy, 9/10 for one file copy. (quad-core, 8 GB memory, SSD for virtual machine)<!----></span><br><br>2. Even if you use a lot of files, it is unnecessary to paste the files into the web page or close the tab quickly, the JS code in the poc already does the same thing. Just copy the files you selected, and click the trigger button. If the `window.close()` in the JS code does not work, you can try the following patch:<span class="line"><!---->2. Even if you use a lot of files, it is unnecessary to paste the files into the web page or close the tab quickly, the JS code in the poc already does the same thing. Just copy the files you selected, and click the trigger button. If the `window.close()` in the JS code does not work, you can try the following patch:<!----></span><br><br>diff --git a/third_party/blink/renderer/core/frame/dom_window.cc b/third_party/blink/renderer/core/frame/dom_window.cc<span class="line"><!---->diff --git a/third_party/blink/renderer/core/frame/dom_window.cc b/third_party/blink/renderer/core/frame/dom_window.cc<!----></span><br>index ea903c66c43..6181e4da2c1 100644<span class="line"><!---->index ea903c66c43..6181e4da2c1 100644<!----></span><br>--- a/third_party/blink/renderer/core/frame/dom_window.cc<span class="line"><!---->--- a/third_party/blink/renderer/core/frame/dom_window.cc<!----></span><br>+++ b/third_party/blink/renderer/core/frame/dom_window.cc<span class="line"><!---->+++ b/third_party/blink/renderer/core/frame/dom_window.cc<!----></span><br>@@ -399,22 +399,22 @@ void DOMWindow::Close(LocalDOMWindow* incumbent_window) {<span class="line"><!---->@@ -399,22 +399,22 @@ void DOMWindow::Close(LocalDOMWindow* incumbent_window) {<!----></span><br>       WebFeature::kWindowProxyCrossOriginAccessClose,<span class="line"><!---->       WebFeature::kWindowProxyCrossOriginAccessClose,<!----></span><br>       WebFeature::kWindowProxyCrossOriginAccessFromOtherPageClose);<span class="line"><!---->       WebFeature::kWindowProxyCrossOriginAccessFromOtherPageClose);<!----></span><br><br>-  Settings* settings = GetFrame()->GetSettings();<span class="line"><!---->-  Settings* settings = GetFrame()-&gt;GetSettings();<!----></span><br>-  bool allow_scripts_to_close_windows =<span class="line"><!---->-  bool allow_scripts_to_close_windows =<!----></span><br>-      settings && settings->GetAllowScriptsToCloseWindows();<span class="line"><!---->-      settings &amp;&amp; settings-&gt;GetAllowScriptsToCloseWindows();<!----></span><br>-<span class="line"><!---->-<!----></span><br>-  if (!page->OpenedByDOM() && GetFrame()->Client()->BackForwardLength() > 1 &&<span class="line"><!---->-  if (!page-&gt;OpenedByDOM() &amp;&amp;         Can you clarify "3/10 for no file copy"?  This bug happens if you try to copy files, it does not happen if you try to copy text.  Do I understand the bug correctly?<span class="line"><!---->Can you clarify "3/10 for no file copy"?  This bug happens if you try to copy files, it does not happen if you try to copy text.  Do I understand the bug correctly?<!----></span><br><br>Correct that a web page itself can trigger paste (via a user action like clicking a button), paste itself does not need to be a user action.  So agreed that a malicious web page could attempt to crash the browser.  So more generally the repro steps could be:<span class="line"><!---->Correct that a web page itself can trigger paste (via a user action like clicking a button), paste itself does not need to be a user action.  So agreed that a malicious web page could attempt to crash the browser.  So more generally the repro steps could be:<!----></span><br><br>1/ User action to copy one or more files into the OS clipboard.<span class="line"><!---->1/ User action to copy one or more files into the OS clipboard.<!----></span><br>2/ User action on the web page to either paste or trigger malicious code.<span class="line"><!---->2/ User action on the web page to either paste or trigger malicious code.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hi rogerta@:<span class="line"><!---->Hi rogerta@:<!----></span><br><br>This vulnerability does not need to copy files, even if you copy text or keep empty in the clipboard, calling `clipHostptr.readFiles` will execute the same path. It's just that `filenames.size()`[*] is 0 at this time, which will cause the time window to be small.<span class="line"><!---->This vulnerability does not need to copy files, even if you copy text or keep empty in the clipboard, calling `clipHostptr.readFiles` will execute the same path. It's just that `filenames.size()`[*] is 0 at this time, which will cause the time window to be small.<!----></span><br><br>[*] <span class="line"><!---->[*] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/enterprise/common/files_scan_data.cc;l=22;drc=96d6572877a23986bf712cf8676ea3978db4eb0f<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/enterprise/common/files_scan_data.cc;l=22;drc=96d6572877a23986bf712cf8676ea3978db4eb0f"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/enterprise/common/files_scan_data.cc;l=22;drc=96d6572877a23986bf712cf8676ea3978db4eb0f<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

          Comment 17<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1395718#c17">Comment 17<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion.         This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks. Removing security view restrictions.<span class="line"><!---->This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks.       UAF in HandleExpandedPaths<span class="line"><!---->UAF in HandleExpandedPaths<!----></span><br><br>VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>When processing the files read request from the clipboard, the current WebContent will be bound[1] into function `HandleExpandedPaths` as a callback. <span class="line"><!---->When processing the files read request from the clipboard, the current WebContent will be bound[1] into function `HandleExpandedPaths` as a callback. <!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void ChromeContentBrowserClient::IsClipboardPasteContentAllowed(<span class="line"><!---->void ChromeContentBrowserClient::IsClipboardPasteContentAllowed(<!----></span><br>    content::WebContents* web_contents,<span class="line"><!---->    content::WebContents* web_contents,<!----></span><br>    const GURL& url,<span class="line"><!---->    const GURL&amp; url,<!----></span><br>    const ui::ClipboardFormatType& data_type,<span class="line"><!---->    const ui::ClipboardFormatType&amp; data_type,<!----></span><br>    const std::string& data,<span class="line"><!---->    const std::string&amp; data,<!----></span><br>    IsClipboardPasteContentAllowedCallback callback) {<span class="line"><!---->    IsClipboardPasteContentAllowedCallback callback) {<!----></span><br>    [...]<span class="line"><!---->    [...]<!----></span><br>    fsd_ptr->ExpandPaths(base::BindOnce(&HandleExpandedPaths, std::move(fsd),   <--- 1.<span class="line"><!---->    fsd_ptr-&gt;ExpandPaths(base::BindOnce(&amp;HandleExpandedPaths, std::move(fsd),   &lt;--- 1.<!----></span><br>                                        web_contents, std::move(dialog_data),<span class="line"><!---->                                        web_contents, std::move(dialog_data),<!----></span><br>                                        connector, std::move(paths),<span class="line"><!---->                                        connector, std::move(paths),<!----></span><br>                                        std::move(callback)));<span class="line"><!---->                                        std::move(callback)));<!----></span><br>    [...]<span class="line"><!---->    [...]<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>This callback will run asynchronously[2][3]:<span class="line"><!---->This callback will run asynchronously[2][3]:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void FilesScanData::ExpandPaths(base::OnceClosure done_closure) {<span class="line"><!---->void FilesScanData::ExpandPaths(base::OnceClosure done_closure) {<!----></span><br>  expand_paths_done_closure_ = std::move(done_closure);    <-------- the callback expand_paths_done_closure_.<span class="line"><!---->  expand_paths_done_closure_ = std::move(done_closure);    &lt;-------- the callback expand_paths_done_closure_.<!----></span><br><br>  base::ThreadPool::PostTaskAndReplyWithResult(<span class="line"><!---->  base::ThreadPool::PostTaskAndReplyWithResult(<!----></span><br>      FROM_HERE, {base::TaskPriority::USER_VISIBLE, base::MayBlock()},<span class="line"><!---->      FROM_HERE, {base::TaskPriority::USER_VISIBLE, base::MayBlock()},<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(&GetPathsToScan, base_paths_),<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(&amp;GetPathsToScan, base_paths_),<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(&FilesScanData::OnExpandPathsDone, AsWeakPtr()));  <----[2] OnExpandPathsDone will be called after the ThreadPool task GetPathsToScan.<span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(&amp;FilesScanData::OnExpandPathsDone, AsWeakPtr()));  &lt;----[2] OnExpandPathsDone will be called after the ThreadPool task GetPathsToScan.<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>void FilesScanData::OnExpandPathsDone(<span class="line"><!---->void FilesScanData::OnExpandPathsDone(<!----></span><br>    std::pair<ExpandedPathsIndexes, std::vector<base::FilePath>><span class="line"><!---->    std::pair&lt;ExpandedPathsIndexes, std::vector&lt;base::FilePath&gt;&gt;<!----></span><br>        indexes_and_paths) {<span class="line"><!---->        indexes_and_paths) {<!----></span><br>  expanded_paths_indexes_ = std::move(indexes_and_paths.first);<span class="line"><!---->  expanded_paths_indexes_ = std::move(indexes_and_paths.first);<!----></span><br>  expanded_paths_ = std::move(indexes_and_paths.second);<span class="line"><!---->  expanded_paths_ = std::move(indexes_and_paths.second);<!----></span><br>  std::move(expand_paths_done_closure_).Run();    <------[3] OnExpandPathsDone will run the callback expand_paths_done_closure_.<span class="line"><!---->  std::move(expand_paths_done_closure_).Run();    &lt;------[3] OnExpandPathsDone will run the callback expand_paths_done_closure_.<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>Therefore, if WebContent is destroyed before `OnExpandPathsDone` gets executed, the UAF will be triggered when it is accessed[4] later.<span class="line"><!---->Therefore, if WebContent is destroyed before `OnExpandPathsDone` gets executed, the UAF will be triggered when it is accessed[4] later.<!----></span><br><br>[1]. <span class="line"><!---->[1]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/chrome_content_browser_client.cc;l=6610;drc=c6170265ae74b21355d013d08a0ad7a0b449d388<a class="undefined" target="_blank" System: test in win<!----></span><br><br>Bisect:<span class="line"><!---->Bisect:<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/c6170265ae74b21355d013d08a0ad7a0b449d388<a owner.<!----></span><br><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>Apply the patch (or enable the preference `enterprise_connectors.on_file_attached` as in *). It has nothing to do with the vulnerability itself.<span class="line"><!---->Apply the patch (or enable the preference `enterprise_connectors.on_file_attached` as in *). It has nothing to do with the vulnerability itself.<!----></span><br><br>$ python ./copy_mojo_js_bindings.py /path/to/chrome/.../out/asan/gen<span class="line"><!---->$ python ./copy_mojo_js_bindings.py /path/to/chrome/.../out/asan/gen<!----></span><br>$ python3 -m http.server 8000<span class="line"><!---->$ python3 -m http.server 8000<!----></span><br>$ out/asan/chrome.exe --user-data-dir=xxxx  --enable-blink-features=MojoJS "<span class="line"><!---->$ out/asan/chrome.exe --user-data-dir=xxxx  --enable-blink-features=MojoJS "<!----></span>http://localhost:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/poc.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/poc.html<!----></a>"<span class="line"><!---->"<!----></span><br><br>[*] <span class="line"><!---->[*] <!----></span>https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/11375053<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/11375053"><!---->https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/11375053<!----></a><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br><br>Type of crash: browser.<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser.<!----></span><br>Crash State: see asan file.<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: see asan file.<!----></span><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Leecraso and Guang Gong of 360 Vulnerability Research Institute<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Leecraso and Guang Gong of 360 Vulnerability Research Institute<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Dec 6, 2022, 4:25 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>

          Cc:<strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          domfc@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -OS-Android -OS-Fuchsia
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          domfc@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -OS-Android -OS-Fuchsia
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        A UAF could happen as described.  ExpandPaths() starts a background task to explode directories into a set of all files descendent from them.  If the tab is closed before the background task can walk the directory trees to collect all the file names, when the background task replies to the originating task, an invalid web content pointer could be accessed.<span class="line"><!---->A UAF could happen as described.  ExpandPaths() starts a background task to explode directories into a set of all files descendent from them.  If the tab is closed before the background task can walk the directory trees to collect all the file names, when the background task replies to the originating task, an invalid web content pointer could be accessed.<!----></span><br><br>Repro steps:<span class="line"><!---->Repro steps:<!----></span><br>------------<span class="line"><!---->------------<!----></span><br>1/ Make sure to enable content analysis (This can only be set via cloud-based enterprise policies so this code path won't happen for consumer users).<span class="line"><!---->1/ Make sure to enable content analysis (This can only be set via cloud-based enterprise policies so this code path won't happen for consumer users).<!----></span><br>2/ Use the OS clipboard copy+paste to copy a directory containing a very large number of files.<span class="line"><!---->2/ Use the OS clipboard copy+paste to copy a directory containing a very large number of files.<!----></span><br>3/ Close the tab quickly.<span class="line"><!---->3/ Close the tab quickly.<!----></span><br><br>Content analysis works only on desktop platforms and cros.<span class="line"><!---->Content analysis works only on desktop platforms and cros.<!----></span><br><br>Carlos: you probably had a hard time repro'ing because you need either a slow computer, a slow disk, a very large/deep directory, or some combination of those things.<span class="line"><!---->Carlos: you probably had a hard time repro'ing because you need either a slow computer, a slow disk, a very large/deep directory, or some combination of those things.<!----></span><br><br>This fix is to pass a WekPtr<WebContents> rather than a naked WebContents pointer and to check that it is still valid.<span class="line"><!---->This fix is to pass a WekPtr&lt;WebContents&gt; rather than a naked WebContents pointer and to check that it is still valid.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2" commenterismember=""></mr-comment>

        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        To expand on repro step #2 above (on Windows):<span class="line"><!---->To expand on repro step #2 above (on Windows):<!----></span><br><br>2.1/ Open the Windows explorer.<span class="line"><!---->2.1/ Open the Windows explorer.<!----></span><br>2.2/ Select a large directory like C:\Windows and type Ctrl+C to copy it.<span class="line"><!---->2.2/ Select a large directory like C:\Windows and type Ctrl+C to copy it.<!----></span><br>2.3/ Open a web page that accepts pasting from the clipboard.<span class="line"><!---->2.3/ Open a web page that accepts pasting from the clipboard.<!----></span><br>2.4/ Type Ctrl+V to paste the files into the web page.<span class="line"><!---->2.4/ Type Ctrl+V to paste the files into the web page.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        @rogerta:<span class="line"><!---->@rogerta:<!----></span><br><br>To prevent misunderstanding, let me clarify:<span class="line"><!---->To prevent misunderstanding, let me clarify:<!----></span><br><br>1. In my local testing, a very large/deep directory is not needed. Success rate: 3/10 for no file copy, 9/10 for one file copy. (quad-core, 8 GB memory, SSD for virtual machine)<span class="line"><!---->1. In my local testing, a very large/deep directory is not needed. Success rate: 3/10 for no file copy, 9/10 for one file copy. (quad-core, 8 GB memory, SSD for virtual machine)<!----></span><br><br>2. Even if you use a lot of files, it is unnecessary to paste the files into the web page or close the tab quickly, the JS code in the poc already does the same thing. Just copy the files you selected, and click the trigger button. If the `window.close()` in the JS code does not work, you can try the following patch:<span class="line"><!---->2. Even if you use a lot of files, it is unnecessary to paste the files into the web page or close the tab quickly, the JS code in the poc already does the same thing. Just copy the files you selected, and click the trigger button.         Can you clarify "3/10 for no file copy"?  This bug happens if you try to copy files, it does not happen if you try to copy text.  Do I understand the bug correctly?<span class="line"><!---->Can you clarify "3/10 for no file copy"?  This bug happens if you try to copy files, it does not happen if you try to copy text.  Do I understand the bug correctly?<!----></span><br><br>Correct that a web page itself can trigger paste (via a user action like clicking a button), paste itself does not need to be a user action.  So agreed that a malicious web page could attempt to crash the browser.  So more generally the repro steps could be:<span class="line"><!---->Correct that a web page itself can trigger paste (via a user action like clicking a button), paste itself does not need to be a user action.  So agreed that a malicious web page could attempt to crash the browser.  So more generally the repro steps could be:<!----></span><br><br>1/ User action to copy one or more files into the OS clipboard.<span class="line"><!---->1/ User action to copy one or more files into the OS clipboard.<!----></span><br>2/ User action on the web page to either paste or trigger malicious code.<span class="line"><!---->2/ User action on the web page to either paste or trigger malicious code.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hi rogerta@:<span class="line"><!---->Hi rogerta@:<!----></span><br><br>This vulnerability does not need to copy files, even if you copy text or keep empty in the clipboard, calling `clipHostptr.readFiles` will execute the same path. It's just that `filenames.size()`[*] is 0 at this time, which will cause the time window to be small.<span class="line"><!---->This vulnerability does not need to copy files, even if you copy text or keep empty in the clipboard, calling `clipHostptr.readFiles` will execute the same path. It's just that `filenames.size()`[*] is 0 at this time, which will cause the time window to be small.<!----></span><br><br>[*] <span class="line"><!---->[*] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/enterprise/common/files_scan_data.cc;l=22;drc=96d6572877a23986bf712cf8676ea3978db4eb0f<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/enterprise/common/files_scan_data.cc;l=22;drc=96d6572877a23986bf712cf8676ea3978db4eb0f"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/enterprise/common/files_scan_data.cc;l=22;drc=96d6572877a23986bf712cf8676ea3978db4eb0f<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

      </button>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
